resources.string: Welcome to Hui Kilo Koholā transect app and mahalo for helping us monitor humpback whales in Hawaii. This app will help provide you with a simple means to log humpback whale sightings during a linear transit between two points meeting the following criteria:

1. Trip not interrupted (e.g., vessel stopped for viewing a whale or for other reasons for more than a few minutes). Note: If interrupted for more than a few minutes, the transect can be stopped and a new one started.
2. Beaufort sea state of 5 or less (< 21 kts).
4. Glare on water of less than 50% (90 of 180 degrees arc being viewed).
5. Use of an observer(s) with required training.
If these conditions are met and able to proceed, please select the Start tab and log-in your vessel and observer(s).
Notification if the transect was not saved remotely
